member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Owl.Core.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Owl.Core.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageConverters.ToBitmap(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor)
member.summary: Will convert a Tensor with 3d shape into a multi-channel bitmap. Tensor shape (Height, Width, Channel) is assumed. Supports 1, 3 and 4 channels. (Grayscale, RGB, ARGB)

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageConverters.FromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: Currently only the 32bppArgb and 24bppRgb formats.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageConverters.FromGrayscaleNormalized(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Returns a grayscale 2D Tensor gray = (0.21 * r + 0.72 * g + 0.07 * b) / 255

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageConverters.FromGrayscale(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Returns a grayscale 2D Tensor gray = 0.21 * r + 0.72 * g + 0.07 * b

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageConverters.ToGrayscale(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor)
member.summary: Direct Tensor to grayscale Bitmap conversion... 0-255 range implied.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageConverters.ToGrayscale(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor,Owl.Core.Structures.Range)
member.summary: Tensor will be trimmed to stay in R range, then remapped to 0 to 255.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageFunctions.Rotate180(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor)
member.summary: Rotating a 2D Tensor 180 degrees is equivalent to reversing it's internal array.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageOperators.ImageMultiply(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor,Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor)
member.summary: A(i) * B(i)

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Images.ImageOperators.ImageAverage(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor)
member.summary: Computes average value of all the Tensor values.

member.summary: Write a single Tensor.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.FromBinary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Read a single TBIN Tensor.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.TryToFindIndices(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Assuming path "C:\tmp\tensorfile.tbin 30 40" this function returns 30 and 40 as the tuple.. index from inclusive and count.

member.summary: Binary data.

member.summary: Nicely formatted CSV file.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.ReadTensors(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read binary Tensors (using the TBIN format) from any stream.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.WriteTensors(System.IO.Stream,Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorSet)
member.summary: Write binary Tensors to any stream using the TBIN file format.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.SaveTensorsBinary(Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorSet,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: For each tensor: 4 bytes int32 length of the tensor in bytes (4 bytes for shapecount + shapecount * 4 bytes + length * 8) 4 bytes int32 shapecount 4*shapecount int32 shape 8*length

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.CountTensorsBinary(System.String)
member.summary: Counts the number of tensors stored in a file

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.LoadTensorsBinary(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: Read that many tensors (or less if not enough)

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.LoadTensorsIDX(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Load a subset of a TensorSet from a file.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.LoadTensorsIDX(System.String)
member.summary: Load the TensorSet from a file.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.LoadTensorIDX(System.String)
member.summary: Read the whole file as one big Tensor. The first dimension of the Tensor indicates the "sample" Tensor with Shape = (100,10,10) is 100 samples of 2D 10x10 Tensors.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.SaveTensorsIDX(Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorSet,System.String,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Will throw an error if the Tensor value is not within the DataType range. Remap the Tensor beforehand if you're not sure about the range of your data.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.LoadTensorsText(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Use "*" to interpret a first non-digit char as the separator.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.IO.TensorSerialization.LoadTensorsText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char)
member.summary: Use "*" to interpret a first non-digit char as the separator.

member.name: P:Owl.Core.LibrarySettings.TensorPrintLength
member.summary: This value sets how many doubles are printed when calling the Tensor.ToString() function. Change it only if you know what you're doing. You have to say "I know what I'm doing" out loud first.

member.name: P:Owl.Core.LibrarySettings.TensorFormat
member.summary: This value is the string formatting used internally by the Tensor.ToString() function to print the Doubles. Change it only if you know what you're doing. You have to say "I know what I'm doing" out loud first.

member.summary: Returns the number of elements in a Tensor with the given shape.

member.name: P:Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor.Width
member.summary: It's just the name for the second array dimension, useful for bitmaps. AKA Column count

member.name: P:Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor.Height
member.summary: It' s just a name for the first array dimension, useful for bitmaps. AKA Row count

member.name: P:Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor.ValueAt(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is only valid when the Tensor has 2D Shape

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor.SplitIntoSet
member.summary: Splits the Tensor into a TensorSet by the leftmost shape dimension. Tensor(2,3) will be splitted into 2 Tensors(3)

member.summary: Returns squared distance value (no sqrt).

member.summary: Apply more complex functions (convolutions ?) to the Tensor

member.summary: Apply more complex functions (convolutions ?) to the Tensor

member.summary: Supports only up to 2 dimensional matrices... sorry.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.RandomClassificationTensor(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Produces a Tensor with one randomly picked value set to ActiveValue. RandomClassificationTensor(4, 1, 0) = {0, 1, 0, 0}

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.PlainTensor(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Produces a Tensor with all values set to InitialValue. PlainTensor(4, 10) = {10, 10, 10, 10}

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.RandomTensor(System.Int32,Owl.Core.Structures.Range)
member.summary: Creates a random Tensor with coordinates values within the Range. RandomTensor(4, 10) = {0.123, 0.234, 0.345, 0.456}

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.JitterTensor(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor)
member.summary: Randomly misplaces the tensor values.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.Interpolate1D(Owl.Core.Tensors.Tensor,System.Int32,Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.TensorInterpolation)
member.summary: Creates a new Tensor by interpolating values from the SourceTensor. Output dependent on the TensorInterpolation.

member.name: T:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.TensorInterpolation
member.summary: Interpolation types for Tensor Interpolation.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorFactory.SeriesTensor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a Tensor based on the series of numbers. SeriesTensor(0, 1, 0.25) = {0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1}

member.name: T:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorBase
member.summary: This abstract class stores Tensor data as a 1D array of double, providing some simple methods.

member.name: P:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorBase.TensorData
member.summary: Returns a direct pointer to the internal array. Won't copy the data.

member.summary: Finds the current range first.

member.summary: Dumb implementation, can cause overflows.

member.name: M:Owl.Core.Tensors.TensorSet.AsArrayArray
